title: ID "Hostage" film titles
content:
[http://web.me.com/laurentbrett/FILMS/HOSTAGE.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20081006194954/http:/web.me.com/laurentbrett/FILMS/HOSTAGE.html "http://web.me.com/laurentbrett/FILMS/HOSTAGE.html")

What is the typeface of the actors’ names?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081006194954im_/http:/typophile.com/files/hostage_4959.gif)

Type Navigator gave me David Berlow’s Rhode Black Extended and Titled Gothic Extended Black. Close, but not it — the mystery font’s diagonal legs of the K and R curve up.

I just saw this and 20 other choice title sequences at the Mill Valley Film Festival’s presentation, “Typecast,” with designer David Peters. He couldn’t recall the name of this typeface.

Thanks.

 [‹ Digital alternative to hand-painted type on boat](http://web.archive.org/web/20081006194954/http:/typophile.com/node/50069 "Go to previous forum topic") [modern serif font? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081006194954/http:/typophile.com/node/50193 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Suz_Syn

comments.content:
I think it’s a freeware font based on the Star Wars logo, or (hopefully) the original font the Star Wars logo was based on.

- Lex
[RedFive](http://web.archive.org/web/20081006194954/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fonthead/red-five/) should do. I’m guessing that because this is on myfonts.com as free it’s legit?
